text: Kevin McCarthy‚Äôs failed leadership has further exacerbated the chaos and crisis in the Republican Conference. The MAGA Republicans successfully vacated the House Speaker! Democrats are going to work hard to keep the government open and prevent the deep cuts in education, healthcare, veterans programs, housing, Social Security, and more. The irresponsible Republicans are endangering our government and our democracy. We will not give up. We will not give in. We will continue our fight for the people!

A joyous and happy birthday to one of the world‚Äôs great Rap artists and pioneers of Trap, the brilliant, well-informed @Tip T.I.! The United States Congressional Black Caucus (@TheBlackCaucus) loves you!
Giuliani was tough on crime when he was Mayor of NYC. Now, Giuliani is tough on law enforcement. My, oh my, don‚Äôt things change when the rabbit‚Äôs got the gun!
Many are worried that the Judge has extended Trump‚Äôs trial date. Not to worry! TRUMP CAN‚ÄôT RUN. TRUMP CAN‚ÄôT HIDE. He will be imprisoned with Ivanka by his side!

I was outraged by Trump‚Äôs conduct and was one of the first Democrats to call for his impeachment. I firmly believed that his deplorable behavior was a reflection of who he truly was, and I grew deeply concerned about the direction he was steering our nation.  msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opin‚Ä¶

California is facing a historic tropical storm. I pray we all remain safe. Please prioritize your safety,  but don‚Äôt panic. Please also remember to check on your elderly or disabled neighbors, and sign up for emergency alerts at alert.lacounty.gov to stay informed and prepared.
God bless the full service of justice. When they go low, the 'sistas' go to law school.
"The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.‚Äù ‚Äì Theodore Parker, (popularized by MLK) #TrumpIndictment4 #TrumpIndictment

Clarence Avant was a brilliant pioneer in the music industry, known by all as the 'Godfather of Black Music.' He opened the doors for many Black artists and was highly respected for his ability to negotiate contracts and change the way Hollywood dealt with young black talent who needed a foot in the door. Clarence joins his beloved wife, Jackie Avant, who passed away Dec 1, 2021. I, along with so many others, are going to miss both Clarence and Jackie so very much. (Photo: Los Angeles, 1978)

I‚Äôm outraged. There‚Äôs something deeply, deeply disturbing about this incident in Braxton, Mississippi, that takes you back in time. Why did 5 Sheriff‚Äôs Deputies and a police officer think they could break down a door, no warrant, and brutalize two black men? Viciously beat, torture, sexually assault, shot one in the mouth... They repeatedly used racial slurs in the course of their violent acts. Ongoing and continuous overt racism, constantly on display, and are we expected to be quiet? cnn.com/2023/08/14/us/missis‚Ä¶

Wow! Can you believe it? Today, we‚Äôre celebrating the 50th anniversary of Hip Hop! Chuck Phillips wrote an article for @latimes in 1994, ‚ÄúRap Finds a Supporter in Representative Maxine Waters,‚Äù describing my testimony in the US Senate fighting all attempts to censor rap music. I read Snoop Doggy Dog lyrics in a Senate hearing. Yes, I did. Hip Hop has changed every aspect of our culture - art forms, style, language, and entertainment. Hip Hop and Rap are here to stay.

The victory in Ohio opposing Issue 1, which would have made it more difficult for proactive freedom of choice advocates to amend the constitution and include abortion rights, was a great victory, not only for Ohio but for our freedom of choice movement. The right of women to make their own choice about their bodies is a human and constitutional right. Despite the unconscionable defeat of Roe v Wade by the US Supreme Court, we, the pro choice advocates, are winning and we are going to win in every state against attempts to deny us our rights to control our bodies.

Harvard law professor and civil rights scholar Charles Ogletree led the fight for justice and compensation for the victims and descendants of the 1921 Black Wall Street Massacre in Tulsa, Oklahoma. 

He took the fight all the way to the Supreme Court saying then, ‚ÄúWe will continue this fight in every venue imaginable and are not going to stop seeking justice.‚Äù

It‚Äôs been announced Charles passed following a long battle with Alzheimer‚Äôs. His exemplary legacy lives on. It‚Äôs now on the rest of us to continue the fight for justice for the harm caused by the destruction of Black Wall Street.

The truth about the lies, bullying, distortions, threats, and the involvement of Donald Trump in the January 6 insurrection that took place at our US Capitol are now revealed in the recent grand jury indictment. Next step: his trials must be made public. Our democracy is at stake!

Today, Trump is expected to be arraigned on four felony charges for efforts to overturn the 2020 election. ‚ÄúPervasive and destabilizing lies about election fraud‚Äù that ‚Äútargeted a bedrock function‚Äù of the US Govt. There are many highly disturbing allegations in the latest 45-page indictment, the third indictment of Trump this year. It is important that the trials be made public. It is so important that the American people experience the trials and fully understand how far this man went to undo our democracy. Way too far.

National Night Out - Visited four cities in California‚Äôs 43rd District: Southeast LA, Inglewood, Lawndale, and Gardena. Great turnout in all cities. My 5-point message to my constituents: 1. Be Safe 2. Be Respectful 3. Don‚Äôt Possess Dangerous Weapons 4. Settle Disputes Peacefully 5. Keep a Positive Attitude. #NationalNightOut #Community

‚ÄúGood Trouble‚Äù Forever: I was honored to preside over the unveiling of the @USPS Forever postage stamp, which commemorates the extraordinary life and legacy of my dear friend and civil rights icon, John R. Lewis. The Los Angeles community embraced the opportunity to honor and celebrate one of the greatest Civil Rights Leaders of our time.  

He devoted his life to strengthening our democracy by championing the right of  every individual to register and cast their vote. John‚Äôs profound impact on America‚Äôs journey toward equality and justice is immortalized for generations to come.

A special thanks to President Biden today for recognizing the harrowing moment in history when young Emmett Till was brutally murdered in Drew, Mississippi. His mother refused to let his untimely death go in vain, and their ordeal in 1955 served as a searing catalyst for the Civil Rights Movement. 

The President‚Äôs proclamation today to establish a monument for Emmett and his mother, Mamie Till-Mobley, is an important step that reaffirms our commitment to confronting the darker aspects of our past ‚Äì as we strive for a more just future.
Trump got some hot mail from special counsel Jack Smith. Possibly facing another indictment -- over efforts to overturn the 2020 election. Possible prison time. Trump, check your mail! More to come.

The strength and courage of the magnificent former South African President, Nelson Mandela, inspired so many people around the world. His strong leadership continues to be an inspiration that remains with us in our struggles for peace, justice, and freedom. #MandelaDay

Will someone please remind Donald Trump that Independence Day is about freedom? And, the amended Constitution is about freedom, justice, equality, protection, and security for all. So Donald Trump, when are you going to condemn the insurrection of our Capitol, where the American Flag that represents that freedom was used to harm and kill those who were trying to protect our Capitol? And when are you going to stop praising our adversaries, Putin in Russia, and Kim Jong-Un in North Korea? And when are you going to admit to your illegal removal of classified documents from the White House that may endanger our relationship with other countries and endanger our own security and freedom? If not now, when?

I suppose Clarence Thomas is happy that he and his billionaire, conservative friends have finally killed the ability to use race as one factor in determining entrance to our colleges and universities. I suppose Clarence Thomas and his privileged, billionaire friends, who own a Supreme Court Justice, can lean back and gloat, while they are resting on their private airplanes and fine vacation sites. Clarence Thomas has just struck a blow against children of color being able to get educated, take positions of power, and eradicate discrimination and racism that denies full equality and opportunity.

Wonderful intergenerational Juneteenth celebration! The presentations of Reps. Justin Pearson and Justin Jones from Tennessee along with prominent civil rights attorney Ben Crump was very informative and very powerful. Great food, historical artifacts, blues, and hip-hop, all made for a great day!

The day has practically passed and many have spent the day with their fathers. How lucky you are. Not everyone has had the honor of spending this day with their father, for many reasons. Fathers, unknown, fathers deceased, fathers in service to our country, fathers in denial‚Ä¶ However, we honor those fathers who have been there for their families, and I am hopeful that in the future more fathers will do the same.

Medgar Evers was brutally assassinated on his doorstep 60 years ago in 1963. He was the NAACP's first Field Secretary for Mississippi
and a freedom fighter of great stature. He was instrumental in the cause of desegregation and led critical voter registration drives in Mississippi. He was one of the great casualties of the Civil Rights Movement, and he was survived by his wife Myrlie Evers, who was a great civil rights leader in her own right and who brought her leadership to California and served as Chair of the Democratic Party in Southern California.

Trump indicted with 7 charges against him. I am not at all surprised. The question becomes, why has it taken so long? Trump is clearly a danger to our government and our Constitution. I am hoping he did not use classified information to cut a deal with his friends in Russia, North Korea or Saudi Arabia to benefit himself. Let justice prevail!

PGA TOUR have you no shame? What won‚Äôt you do for money? Your merger with Saudi Arabia is outrageous and unacceptable. The Office of the Director of National Intelligence assessed that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman approved an operation in Istanbul Turkey, to capture or kill Saudi Journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Khashoggi was brutally murdered and dismembered inside the Saudi Consulate in Istanbul. I am requesting that this merger be reviewed by The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States for its National Security implications. nytimes.com/interactive/2021‚Ä¶

Happy Pride Month! I will be walking, talking, and participating in civic activities with my friends in the LGBTQ community. I am proud of the progress that we have made, in the LGBTQ community, however, I am worried about the attacks on innocent individuals in the Transgender community and I stand with the LBGTQ community in fighting against discrimination, ignorance, hate, and violence. #PrideMonth üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàüè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è

Yes, we passed the Debt Limit increase legislation yesterday. The Republicans demanded huge cuts across the board and they attempted to hold Democrats hostage. President Biden and his team worked very hard and they were able to minimize some of the cuts, but not all of them. It was important to keep our country from defaulting on our debt. Not everyone is happy, however, the people of this country are better off, because we passed legislation that will keep our country operating.

What does Memorial Day really mean? It is referred to as ‚Äúthose who have made the ultimate sacrifice.‚Äù They have died. Oftentimes, people think, ‚Äúdied in combat.‚Äù However, what about those soldiers who have died because they come home and did not have a home? What about those who have died from toxic burn pits or a lack of healthcare? They too have made the ultimate sacrifice. It‚Äôs not just about those who have died at the end of a gun. It includes the people who have died because their disability was not recognized, or they weren‚Äôt cared for back home. #MemorialDay

Tina Turner was one of the most famous songstresses and performers in the world. Tina Turner came from very humble beginnings and an abusive marriage but survived it all and parlayed her god-given talent into some of the best entertainment that was ever recorded or played on stages all over the world. Tina Turner will certainly be imitated, modeled after, written about, and remembered, not only for her music but her dance and certainly her legs!

Jim Brown, one of the greatest athletes the world has known, whose Rush record held for 40 years, and who was my husband Sid William‚Äôs teammate on the Cleveland Browns, and our dear friend, has passed away. Jim Brown was not only a superb athlete, he was a civil rights activist and founded ‚ÄúAmer-I-Can‚Äù¬†an organization that helped to change the lives of young gang members in LA. Jim‚Äôs record as a Fullback and as a movie star will be superbly recorded in history.

Happy 58th Anniversary to Head Start! I love Head Start! Not only does it change the lives of children and families, it changed my life when I started working as an Assistant Teacher in the Head Start program in the first year of its operation. The Congress of the U.S. must always properly fund the Head Start program for the children of our country.

My dear friend and colleague supervisor Gloria Molina has passed. Gloria Molina served in the California State Assembly, LA City Council, and LA County Board of Supervisors. Gloria was strong, and effective, at every level of government where she served. She challenged the status quo and she opened up opportunities for Mexican Americans. Her achievements of great governance will be recorded in history!
Remembering my wonderful Mother, long since passed, and a very happy Mother‚Äôs Day to all the Mothers everywhere! #HappyMothersDay

Let me be clear, being hungry and homeless is NOT a crime & Jordan Neely should still be with us. We will continue the fight for a better future. One where everyone can grow old, & no one is without a roof over their head. Here‚Äôs my latest for @HuffPost. huffpost.com/entry/rep-maxin‚Ä¶

And so we have something called ‚ÄúTeacher Appreciation Week‚Äù but do we really appreciate teachers? Teachers are underfunded, under-supported, and really under-appreciated. States and unified school districts must pay our teachers, the pay they truly deserve, and then we can have a true Teacher Appreciation Week! #TeacherAppreciation

Once again another mass shooting, my heart goes out to the families of those individuals killed and harmed in the Allen Texas shopping center massacre. To the GOP members of Congress, stop being owned by the NRA, join the Democrats to pass responsible gun safety legislation. Everyone is in danger. Your children, or your grandchildren at school, you or your mate in a shopping center, or any public place. We have the ability to pass gun safety laws, and each day it‚Äôs proven, that otherwise, this is going to continue, day after day, week after week, month after month. Gun violence must be stopped!

History teaches us that if you believe you have a right to freedom, you must be willing to fight for it. Mexicans fought for their freedom against the powerful French and won. We celebrate Cinco De Mayo, because of the conviction & the courage of Mexicans against imperialism!

The brave, courageous, civil rights Freedom Riders, put their lives on the line in the struggle for civil rights in this country. One of the most revered civil rights leaders in those Freedom Rides of 1961 was our beloved John Lewis who served in the US Congress from, 1987-2020.

Freedom of the Press, along with Freedom of Speech are the true marks of a democratic society. Even if we disagree, it is important for us to defend their role in supporting our democracy. President Biden did a great job of honoring the press at the recent Correspondent's Dinner!

Another superstar has just passed. My dear friend, Harry Belafonte, was an extraordinarily talented singer and performer. More than that, he was a civil rights activist who marched with Dr. Martin Luther King and worked with President Nelson Mandela to end Apartheid in South Africa. We will all miss his wisdom, his advice, and his huge giving spirit.

Don‚Äôt know for sure if the firing of Tucker Carlson is connected to the lies & accusations of voter fraud perpetrated by Fox News, Trump, & his sycophants against you, Dominion Voting Systems. Thank you for your fight and your lawsuit, you beat the hell out of them, bye-bye @TuckerCarlson!
Received the Community Empowerment Leader Award from the Speak Up Empowerment Foundation‚Äôs, 7th annual Ms. Single Mom forum. Busy busy day!
Great day with the youth! Rode in the City of Lawndale Youth Day Parade in my District and presented community project funding at the end of parade community event.

Attended Earth Day Community Clean Up in the City of Gardena, in my District, and toured the Willows Wetland Preserve. Spoke at HACLA and Watts Rising Earth Day Celebration: Rooted Residents, Thriving Trees Event.

742 people have been killed in mass shootings in 2022 & 23. Too many legislators are worshiping at the altar of the NRA. They don‚Äôt care that in addition to adults, innocent little children are being killed. Shame on us all, where are our hearts & our minds? It‚Äôs got to stop!

No no! Denying women the right to abortion, overturning the FDA‚Äôs approval of the pill, Mifepristone. Judges can‚Äôt stop us, the SCOTUS can‚Äôt stop us. And Clarence Thomas needs to clean up his own house and not mess around in our house. Women will win this fight!

Airman Jack Teixeira stole classified documents and shared them with others. Trump loves Kim Jong Un in North Korea, and Putin in Russia. Trump aided in the January 6th Insurrection. Marjorie T Green defended Teixeira. What the hell? Our Democracy is at stake!

The Tennessee Three, must be admired by all who believe in justice and freedom. They demonstrated courage and willingness to sacrifice, to have their voices heard on the issue of guns and violence. They resisted being shut down, and they have won. They deserve our support!

Happy 93rd birthday to my dear & beloved friend Dolores Huerta. Dolores is one of the most respected leaders in this country. She is a strong & energetic advocate on behalf of women, farm workers, organized labor, people of color & so much more. Dolores you are loved by millions!

Easter Sunday, I celebrated The Resurrection at the City of Refuge Church, a wonderful message from Bishop Noel Jones. Then joined the third shift at the LA Mission serving food to the unhoused and the homeless. We must solve the homeless problem in LA and the entire country!
Happy Resurrection, Ramadan and Passover! Religious freedom, is a wonderful thing.

The unbelievable, nasty¬†expelling of the two Black legislators in Tennessee may violate the Voting Rights Act and even the Constitution. We may need to attempt to undo the so-called right, for legislative bodies, to determine their authority to expel members. The fight is on!

I just returned from St. Kitts. Attended the funeral of my dear friend and freedom fighter Randall Robinson. He founded TransAfrica Forum and led the fight to free Nelson Mandela and end Apartheid in South Africa. He fought for freedom & justice at home and throughout the world.

Today, Trump will be arraigned following the indictment by a grand jury in New York. He won‚Äôt be shown giving his fingerprints or getting a mugshot, but it will happen. A true indication that no one is above the law, including a disgraced former President. Hallelujah!

Today marks the 55th anniversary of the assassination of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. We sadly remember this terrible loss to our country and our world. He was the nonviolent leader for civil rights & human rights. Let‚Äôs think about what we each can do, to follow in his footsteps.

Cesar Chavez is one of the greatest leaders that ever lived. He challenged the terrible conditions imposed by big agricultural interests to bring about support, respect, & opportunity for farm workers & he won. Latino leaders today are carrying on your legacy. Thank you, Cesar.
SO Trump finally got indicted! I predicted he would and I predicted that Stormy Daniels would get him! Sometimes justice works! #TrumpIndictment

To my dear friend, Myrlie Evers who has survived & overcome. God bless you on your 90th birthday! May you ever enjoy a wonderful & peaceful life. We will always honor the sacrifice your husband made for civil rights when he was assassinated on your doorstep. All our love to you!

Former Congresswoman Pat Schroeder was in Congress, 1973 to 1997. Pat died yesterday, March 13th. Great activist supporting woman‚Äôs causes & known for shutting down right-wing radio host Rush Limbaugh. Legislator extraordinaire, her contributions are well documented in history!

3/13/2020, 12:40 am, Breonna Taylor was killed by Louisville Police in the bed where she slept. According to the DOJ, the Louisville Police uses ‚Äúexcessive force‚Äù & ‚Äúunlawfully discriminates against Black people.‚Äù The truth is coming out, we must stop the racist killings!

Silicon Valley Bank depositors, both insured & uninsured, will be made whole by the plan from the FDIC, the Federal Reserve, the Treasury & the White House. And the Fed has created a new facility to support all banks that need liquidity to ensure our banking system is safe.

I have lived to see the first Black woman become a Supreme Court Justice, appointed by President Biden. What a tremendous achievement for Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, Happy International Women‚Äôs Day! #InternationalWomensDay

I am proud and thankful that I broke the glass ceiling in the House of Representatives and served as the first woman and first Black to become Chairwoman of the House Financial Services Committee. I will use my time and resources to help other women get elected to office!

I am proud of the gains that women are making in every sector of our society, but let history record that I care about women of humble means and resources, and the women who have made it must dedicate ourselves to helping the women who truly need us.

Women are confronted with the basic issue of whether or not they are going to control their own bodies. Attempts from right-wing conservatives to take away this decision must be resisted at every level until we win!

I spent Saturday and Sunday in Selma, Alabama. I joined with Pres. Biden, and many people from all over the country, commemorating the beating of civil rights activists crossing the Edmund Pettus Bridge, on March 7, 1965.

My dear @HarryBelafonte you are a blessed man! One of the world‚Äôs greatest singers and entertainers, a leader of the civil rights movement, and a commitment to peace and justice everywhere. Happy birthday, may God bless you always!
sandiegouniontribune.com/new‚Ä¶

Barbara Jordan, Congresswoman extraordinaire. Articulate, brilliant, & profound. Had she lived, she would be 91 years old today. During this Black History Month, we celebrate her extraordinary leadership. Her magnificent voice still rings in my ear. Happy birthday Barbara Jordan.

During this Black History Month, still I sadly recall the assassination of Malcolm X, February 21st, 1965, who brought to America, a very poignant message denouncing injustice, inequality, and racism.
God bless our former President Jimmy Carter.
Donald Trump is just mad because the multibillionaire Rihanna is richer than he is, and also more talented. You go girl!
The world looks to us for help, and help we must provide, to the people of Syria and Turkey. The loss of life, over 30,000 dead, is unimaginable. Let‚Äôs do what we can for the people.

Attended a great celebration in honor of a legendary musical icon, Vicente Fern√°ndez! Thousands in attendance, and an important recognition of establishing statues in honor of Mexican heroes, inspiring young people to be proud of their heritage and their culture.

February is Black History Month. It is a time when we honor & celebrate the contributions & achievements made by Black people in this country. It is also a time when we remember the sacrifices, and lives lost in the quest for justice and equality. And Happy Birthday Rosa Parks!

The facts of the killing of Tyre Nichols continue to unfold. No evidence of reckless driving found. 7 police officers involved in shouting 71 commands as he was being viciously beaten & tased. They killed him. We must fight even harder for justice & reform. Out with bad police!

It‚Äôs so heartbreaking that 10 innocent people have been killed while celebrating the Lunar New Year in Monterey Park. I will continue to 
join with members of Congress to eliminate this proliferation of guns. We must never give up on dismantling the pro-gun lobby & saving lives.

MLK said, ‚ÄúThe ultimate tragedy is not the oppression & cruelty by the bad people but the silence over that by the good people.‚Äù Jan 3rd, LA Police excessively tasered Keenan Anderson a 31-year-old black man, English teacher & father. He died 4 hours later. We must not be silent.
So honored to receive the lifetime achievement award at the #UrbanOneHonors award ceremony tomorrow, Monday, January 16th!

Unfortunately, the state of CA is experiencing what is being described as "weather whiplash," resulting in deadly storms w/more rain & flooding on the way. During the Governor's state of emergency, I encourage you to remain safe & prepared by following the guidance from @Cal_OES

The January 6th, 2021 Invasion of The U.S. Capitol by domestic terrorists, led by the then President of the U.S. I will never forgive or forget. The unwillingness of some U.S. Reps who claim to be Patriots, to condemn the Insurrectionists will never ever deserve trust or respect.

Know that I am Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries‚Äô greatest supporter. After 6 House vote attempts, Kevin McCarthy should step aside in shame and embarrassment. He does not have the votes. Enough is enough!

I do believe that 2023, will be more prosperous, more constructive, and more open for opportunities for diversity and inclusion in our country. The U.S. will continue to fight to protect our democracy and to provide leadership in the fight for democracy around the world.
